column1: Samawah or As-Samawah (Arabic language: السماوة) is a city in Iraq
column2: 280 kilometres (174 mi) southeast of Baghdad.The city of Samawah is the modern capital of the Al Muthanna Governorate. The city is located midway between Baghdad and Basra
column3: at the northern edge of the governorate. The province was established in 1975; prior to that date it was a unified province along with Qadissiya (Diwaniya) and Najaf.

column1: == History and attractions ==

The city was settled by the Arab tribe of Banu Quda'a around the 3rd century AD. It is built on both sides of the Euphrates river; there are four bridges in the centre of town for crossing between the two sides. The west bank of the city contains the commercial heart of the city
column2: and includes the old town and the Jewish quarter
column3: agd al yahood.  The west bank is the site of the covered market Suq Al Masgoof
column4: which dates to the Ottoman period. The area surrounding the market is the old city with its Byzantine maze of crowded markets and streets.

column1: Samawah is built on both sides of the Euphrates and is surrounded by hundreds of palm groves that give it a tropical feel
column2: especially in the southern and northern suburbs. These groves provide cool respite from the scorching heat of Mesopotamia and were the inspiration for the famous Iraqi folk song "The Palm of Samawah".

column1: Samawah has a large salt lake called Sawa Lake
column2: which once had a tourist village that has since fallen into disrepair. The lake is located 25 km (15 mi) to the north of the city centre and is accessible by road. The lake has no obvious source
column3: neither river nor ancient link to a sea. The water is extremely salty due to heavy evaporation in the searing heat of Mesopotamia and supports no marine life. A unique feature of the lake is that the water is above ground level surrounded by natural levees. Due to the high levels of salt in the lake
column4: the levees heal themselves if a break is made in the levee
column5: stopping the water from flowing down to ground level. The salt levels also improve buoyancy
column6: and many migratory birds walk on the lake.

column1: == Geography ==
=== Climate ===

Samawah has a hot desert climate (BWh) in the Köppen–Geiger climate classification system. Most rain falls in the winter. The average annual temperature in Samawah is 23.8 °C (74.8 °F). About 106 mm (4.17 in) of precipitation falls annually.

column1: == Reaching Samawah ==

Samawah is served by a highway for road traffic from Baghdad and Basra. The railway station has passenger services from both Baghdad and Basra and is the cheapest form of transport. The railway station is located approximately 4 kilometers (2.5 mi) to the west of central Samawah.
Samawah is also accessible via the Euphrates River.
